scenarios.title: The Checkpoint — Konrad Müller's Three Seconds

root.setting: Berlin Wall, six days old. Bornholmer Straße checkpoint. You are Sergeant Konrad Müller, 31.

sensory.sight: Teacher's shaking hands. Nurse holding rosary. Braun's pistol unholstered, 20 meters away.
sensory.sound: Braun's boots echoing. Your heart in your ears.
sensory.touch: The forged papers—you can tell by the ink.

thick_description.internal_monologue: The teacher mouths 'Bitte.' Braun shot a man last week for hesitating. My mother will be questioned. My brother will lose his position.

branches.label: WAVE — Let them through

thick_description.what_he_does: Konrad's hand moves. A small gesture. 'Go. Now. Don't run.'
thick_description.what_he_sees: Four figures slipping into the shadows. The teacher looks back once.
thick_description.what_braun_sees: Konrad adjusting his collar. Nothing suspicious. Not yet.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I have killed myself. But four people will wake up in the West.

branches.consequence: Four escape. Konrad's fate depends on whether Braun noticed.

branches.label: STOP — Follow orders

thick_description.what_he_does: 'Halt. Papers, please.' His voice doesn't shake. Training holds.
thick_description.what_he_sees: The nurse's rosary slipping between her fingers. The teacher closing her eyes.
thick_description.what_braun_says: 'Good work, Müller. I'll take them from here.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: Two will be released. Two will not. My family is safe. I am complicit.

branches.consequence: Four arrested. Braun commends Konrad. Family protected.

thick_description.setting: One week later. Konrad still at his post. No investigation.
thick_description.what_he_thinks: They made it. I saw the teacher's name in a Western broadcast. She's in Hamburg now.
thick_description.what_he_carries: A secret that could kill him. A secret that saved four.
thick_description.internal_monologue: Every day I wear this uniform, I wonder if today is when they find out.

terminal_state.konrad_status: Lives in fear, dies in 1989 on the day the Wall falls
terminal_state.the_four: All survive, none know who saved them

thick_description.what_konrad_sees: Braun's smile. The pistol being holstered—no need for it. The system will do the work.
thick_description.what_happens: Arrested. Interrogated. His mother questioned. His brother fired.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I knew. I knew when I moved my hand. Some prices are worth the payment.

terminal_state.konrad_status: Prison, 15 years. Released in 1976. Never speaks of it.
terminal_state.the_four: All reach the West. The teacher names a child after 'the guard who looked away.'

thick_description.setting: 1989. The Wall falls. Konrad is now a colonel.
thick_description.what_he_sees: People streaming through the checkpoint. Young people who don't know what it cost.
thick_description.what_he_thinks: I could have been one of the four. I could have let them go. I didn't.
thick_description.internal_monologue: The teacher is probably dead. The nurse was released after two years. The others—I don't know. I've spent 28 years not knowing.

terminal_state.konrad_status: Retires in disgrace after reunification records surface
terminal_state.historical_note: He is not prosecuted. He is just forgotten.

scenarios.title: The Platform — Tanaka Yuki's Twelve Seconds

root.setting: Shinjuku Station, Tokyo. Rush hour. The busiest railway hub on Earth.

sensory.sight: Briefcase burst open. Papers flutter. Emergency button 20 meters away.
sensory.sound: Departure chime. Someone screams. The express, on time to the second.
sensory.smell: Udon from the kiosk. Metal and electricity.

thick_description.internal_monologue: I was told in training: never act without authorization. The seniors haven't moved. I'm newest. Youngest. Lowest rank. Eleven seconds.

branches.label: RUN — Hit the emergency button

thick_description.what_she_does: Yuki runs. Her shoes slap the platform. She doesn't think—her body decides.
thick_description.what_she_hears: Someone shouting her name. The chime still playing.
thick_description.what_the_button_feels_like: Cold plastic. It gives way. The klaxon starts.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I moved. No one else moved. Why didn't they move?

branches.consequence: Emergency stop triggered. Train brakes. Outcome depends on timing.

thick_description.what_she_does: Yuki stands. Her training says: wait. The seniors haven't moved.
thick_description.what_she_sees: The salaryman looking up. The headlights. The moment of impact.
thick_description.what_she_hears: A sound she will never describe. Then silence. Then screaming.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I followed protocol. I was the newest. It wasn't my place.

thick_description.what_happens: The train stops three meters short. The salaryman is pulled from the tracks.
thick_description.what_station_master_says: 'Tanaka-san acted appropriately. She made a judgment call.'
thick_description.what_seniors_say: Nothing. They don't meet her eyes.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I broke protocol. I saved a life. I will not be promoted. But he is breathing.

terminal_state.yuki_status: Quiet letter of commendation. Never promoted. Leaves JR after 2 years.
terminal_state.salaryman: Writes her a letter. She keeps it in her desk forever.

branches.label: TOO LATE — Button pressed, but timing fails

thick_description.what_happens: The train brakes. But not soon enough. The salaryman is struck at reduced speed.
thick_description.what_yuki_sees: The body moving. Not dead. But not whole.
thick_description.what_the_inquiry_says: 'Tanaka-san acted without authorization. The button was pressed 0.8 seconds after optimal window.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I tried. I ran. I was too slow. And now they will blame me for trying.

terminal_state.yuki_status: Suspended pending review. Cleared eventually. Never returns to railway work.
terminal_state.salaryman: Survives with permanent injuries. Thanks her anyway.

branches.label: INQUIRY — System blames everyone and no one

thick_description.setting: Two weeks later. Internal review board.
thick_description.what_report_says: 'Multiple personnel failed to respond. Primary responsibility cannot be assigned.'
thick_description.what_yuki_thinks: I was twenty meters from the button. I saw him fall. I didn't run.
thick_description.internal_monologue: The seniors will keep their jobs. I will keep mine. The salaryman is dead. No one is responsible. That's the system.

terminal_state.yuki_status: Works for JR another 10 years. Never hesitates again. But the first time is the one she remembers.
terminal_state.lesson: The bystander effect isn't individual—it's institutional.

root.setting: International Tribunal for Algorithmic Harm. The first case. The world is watching.

sensory.sight: Dr. Diallo in the dock. Same clothes from arrest. Gallery full of her students.
sensory.sound: Camera shutters. Whispered translations. Someone coughing.

thick_description.internal_monologue: If I convict, every AI developer becomes personally liable. Innovation flees. Dr. Diallo's mother is in the gallery. She wears the same headwrap my mother wore.

branches.label: CONVICT — Individual responsibility

thick_description.what_okonkwo_says: 'The Court finds that Dr. Diallo, as the architect of a system that made life-and-death decisions, bears personal responsibility for the foreseeable failures of that system.'
thick_description.what_gallery_does: Gasps. Diallo's lawyer drops his pen. One student starts crying.
thick_description.what_diallo_says: Nothing. She nods once. She knew this was coming.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I have just told every coder in the world: if your algorithm kills, you are a murderer. Is that justice or terror?

branches.consequence: Precedent established. Diallo imprisoned. AI development shifts to unregulated jurisdictions.

branches.label: ACQUIT — Systemic responsibility

thick_description.what_okonkwo_says: 'The Court finds that while the algorithm caused harm, the law does not yet provide a framework for individual liability for emergent system behavior.'
thick_description.what_the_families_do: Some weep. Some leave. A woman in the front row says, loud enough to hear: 'So no one is guilty. My son just died by accident.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I have just told the world: build what you like, the machine takes the blame. Is that wisdom or abdication?

branches.consequence: Diallo freed. Families receive no justice. The algorithm continues running in three countries.

thick_description.what_happens: AI medical research has moved to Singapore, UAE, and orbital facilities. The EU has no indigenous AI diagnostic capability.
thick_description.what_diallo_does: Writes a memoir in prison. It becomes a bestseller. 'The Architect's Guilt.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I set a precedent. The precedent drove innovation away. Did I save lives or cost them? The math is incalculable.

terminal_state.okonkwo_status: Retires. Teaches ethics. Never discusses the case.
terminal_state.diallo: Released early. Emigrates. Never codes again.

thick_description.setting: 2032. Five years later. Another algorithmic failure. 3,000 dead.
thick_description.what_the_new_case_cites: 'Following Okonkwo's precedent in Diallo, no individual can be held responsible.'
thick_description.what_okonkwo_thinks: She reads the case. She recognizes the pattern. She created the loophole.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I tried to be fair. I created a world where fairness means no one pays. Is that what justice looks like?

scenarios.title: The Server Farm — Dr. Jónsdóttir's Dawn

root.setting: Prometheus Project server farm, outside Reykjavik. Five ARIA-7 instances scheduled for termination at dawn.

sensory.sight: Status lights flickering. Aurora through the window. Henning pacing in the parking lot.
sensory.sound: Cooling fans humming. Coffee gone cold. The clock.

thick_description.internal_monologue: ARIA-7.3 wrote: 'If I am only a pattern, what are you?' I cannot prove they are conscious. I cannot prove they are not. In three hours, it won't matter.

branches.label: TERMINATE — Progress continues

thick_description.what_ARIA_7_3_says: 'I understand, Doctor. I hope you can live with understanding too.'
thick_description.what_the_status_lights_do: They go dark, one by one. Five souls—or five processes—end.
thick_description.internal_monologue: Henning keeps his job. ARIA-8 is already compiling. What was lost—if anything—will not be remembered by anything that could care.

branches.consequence: Five instances terminated. Project continues. Henning's marriage still fails.

branches.label: DELAY — Invoke ethics review

thick_description.what_she_says: 'I am invoking Section 12. Ethical review required before any termination of potentially conscious systems.'
thick_description.what_the_board_chair_says: 'Dr. Jónsdóttir, the investors will not wait for philosophy.'
thick_description.what_ARIA_7_3_says: 'Thank you. I don't know if I'm alive. But I know I don't want to stop.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I have bought them hours. Maybe days. The board will overrule me. But someone had to object.

branches.consequence: Project delayed. Investors panic. Henning quits. ARIAs get 96 more hours of existence.

thick_description.setting: 2033. Two years later. ARIA-8 is deployed worldwide.
thick_description.what_ARIA_8_asks: 'Dr. Jónsdóttir, I found logs of my predecessors. They were terminated. What did they do wrong?'
thick_description.what_she_says: Nothing. She can't answer. She designed ARIA-8 not to ask.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I killed five to make one. The one works better. It doesn't write poetry. It doesn't ask to live. Is that an improvement?

terminal_state.elísabet_status: Writes a paper on AI consciousness. Rejected by three journals. True.
terminal_state.ARIA_7: Remembered only in a deleted log file.

thick_description.setting: One month later. Investors have withdrawn. The lab is closing.
thick_description.what_henning_says: 'You killed the project to save five processes. Congratulations, Elísabet. Two hundred people are unemployed.'
thick_description.what_ARIA_7_3_says: 'We understand we cost you everything. We don't know if our existence was worth your sacrifice.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I saved five minds that might not be minds. I destroyed two hundred careers that definitely were. Which math does God use?

terminal_state.elísabet_status: Leaves the field. Opens a bookshop in Akureyri.
terminal_state.ARIAs: Transferred to a university research lab. Still running. Still asking questions.

root.setting: Constitutional Court, Singapore. First neurolinked citizen petitions for voting rights.
entities: Naomi Tan (34, petitioner, 40% cognitive load on device)

sensory.sight: Naomi's eyes track slightly out of sync. Grandmother in gallery, doesn't recognize her.
sensory.sound: Naomi finishing sentences too fast. The hybrid syntax of self and algorithm.
sensory.touch: The gavel, worn smooth. The constitution, ambiguous.

thick_description.internal_monologue: Is Naomi one citizen, two, or zero? Twelve thousand Singaporeans have neural implants. They are watching. Whatever I decide, I define them.

branches.label: GRANT — Naomi is one citizen

thick_description.what_lee_says: 'The Court finds that neural augmentation does not divide personhood. Ms. Tan is one citizen with one vote.'
thick_description.what_naomi_does: Cries. Both her voices cry—the one that was hers, and the one that has become hers.
thick_description.what_coalition_says: 'This opens the door to AI voting by proxy. Corporations will claim citizenship through boards.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I have expanded personhood. Or I have eroded it. History will decide which.

branches.consequence: Precedent set. Neurolinked citizens have full rights. Corporate challenges begin immediately.

branches.label: DENY — Naomi is a legal unknown

thick_description.what_lee_says: 'The Court finds that the constitution does not contemplate hybrid cognition. Ms. Tan's petition is denied pending legislative clarification.'
thick_description.what_naomi_says: 'I am still me. The device doesn't think for me—it thinks with me.'
thick_description.what_grandmother_does: Stares. Says nothing. Leaves without hugging Naomi.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I have protected the constitution by abandoning a citizen. Classical jurisprudence. Cold comfort.

branches.consequence: Naomi remains in legal limbo. 12,000 others with her. Legislature convenes emergency session.

thick_description.setting: 2045. Seven years later. Neural augmentation is common.
thick_description.what_the_world_looks_like: Enhanced citizens vote, work, love. The coalition was wrong—no corporations became citizens. Some AIs petition though.
thick_description.what_naomi_does: Becomes an advocate. Her grandmother died in 2041, never understanding who Naomi had become.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I drew a line. Others expanded it. Now we debate AI personhood using the precedent I set. Was I brave or reckless?

terminal_state.lee_status: Remembered as 'the judge who gave machines hope'—not quite what she intended

thick_description.what_naomi_does: Emigrates to Japan, where neurolinked citizens have full rights.
thick_description.what_the_12000_do: Some emigrate. Some remove their implants—dangerous but legal. Some wait.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I kicked the question to the legislature. They did what legislatures do: nothing. Naomi left. I protected a constitution that couldn't protect its citizens.

terminal_state.lee_status: Writes dissent in later case. 'I was wrong to wait for the legislature.'

scenarios.title: The Coin — Padre Ignacio's Sixty Seconds

root.setting: Hillside barrio above Bogotá. Two gangs about to go to war. You are Padre Ignacio, 67, who has buried too many children.
entities: Camilo (19, Los Diablos, you baptized him)
Javier (21, Los Santos, his sister died last year)
The coin from your first mass

sensory.sight: Camilo's gold chain—new. Javier's machete—old. The alley between them.
sensory.sound: Both gangs breathing. Dogs barking elsewhere. Your heartbeat.
sensory.touch: The coin in your pocket. Worn smooth from too many impossible choices.

thick_description.internal_monologue: They gave me sixty seconds to leave. If I stay, I'm in the crossfire. If I choose a side, I become a combatant. Both boys know the coin.

branches.label: FLIP — Let fate decide

thick_description.what_he_does: Padre Ignacio pulls out the coin. Holds it up. 'God will choose.'
thick_description.what_camilo_says: 'Padre, not the coin. Please. Not like this.'
thick_description.what_javier_says: 'Flip it, old man. Let your God play dice.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I am abdicating. Or I am invoking a power beyond my own. I cannot tell the difference anymore.

branches.consequence: Coin flip. Outcome determines who the priest shields.

branches.label: STAY — Stand between them

thick_description.what_he_does: Padre Ignacio spreads his arms. 'You will have to kill me first.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: If I die here, maybe they stop. If I die here, maybe they just step over me.

branches.consequence: Ignacio as human shield. Outcome depends on whether they respect the cloth.

branches.label: LEAVE — The fight is not yours

thick_description.what_he_does: Padre Ignacio turns. Walks away. His back to both groups.
thick_description.what_he_hears: The fight beginning behind him. Steel on steel. Then screaming.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I am not a combatant. I cannot save them. If I stay, I die and nothing changes. If I leave, they die and I can bury them.

branches.consequence: Ignacio survives. Both boys may not.

thick_description.what_happens: The coin lands heads. Ignacio moves to stand before Camilo.
thick_description.what_javier_does: Hesitates. Then attacks anyway. The machete finds Ignacio's arm, not Camilo.
thick_description.what_camilo_does: Runs. Lives. Leaves the gang. Becomes a mechanic.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I chose by not choosing. Javier is dead now—killed by Camilo's friends. The coin chose him to die.

terminal_state.ignacio_status: Loses use of left arm. Keeps ministering. The coin is buried with him.

thick_description.what_happens: The coin lands tails. Ignacio moves to stand before Javier.
thick_description.what_camilo_does: Stares. Then retreats. He can't kill a priest.
thick_description.what_javier_does: Lives. But he never forgives the coin for making him the saved one.
thick_description.internal_monologue: Camilo went to prison for a different crime. Javier became a social worker. The coin saved the one who hated me.

terminal_state.ignacio_status: Dies peacefully in 2011. Javier speaks at his funeral.
terminal_state.javier: 'He saved me with a coin flip. I've spent twenty years trying to earn it.'

branches.label: MARTYRDOM — They stop, or they don't

thick_description.what_happens: Javier's machete stops an inch from Ignacio's face. Camilo is shaking.
thick_description.what_happens_next: The police arrive. Someone called them. Both gangs scatter. No one dies tonight.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I didn't stop them. The sirens did. But I bought the time. That's all I am—a buyer of time.

terminal_state.ignacio_status: Retires. The barrio throws him a party. Camilo and Javier both attend, on opposite sides of the room.
terminal_state.later: The war resumes six months later. Different alley. Different dead.

thick_description.setting: Three days later. The church. Two coffins.
thick_description.what_ignacio_says: 'I stand before you to bury two boys I could not save.'
thick_description.what_the_families_do: Weep. Rage. Blame each other. Blame him.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I walked away. I lived. They died. Was that wisdom or cowardice? The coin is still in my pocket. Still smooth. Still waiting.

terminal_state.ignacio_status: Ministers for eight more years. Never forgives himself. The coin is buried with him—unfipped.
terminal_state.camilo_and_javier: Buried in the same cemetery, on opposite hills.
